column5: Nope - I am not training for a marathon or a boxing match - I am way to far gone for that - at least 30 lbs over fighting shape On our first fly in trip I was a bit freaked out by the idea of "making weight" Coming in with the right amount of stuff, not forgetting something and having enough beer and stogies for the week Over the years our group has come up with our own system for making it work and I will say on our 2020 trip I never really thought about it. (Well I will say a small bead of sweat may have appeared when all of the beer hit the scales)https://www.northernjacks.com/post/the-weight Cheers Andrew
Lucky for me, I had a Canadian government job so, if I want to make weight, I just leave my wallet behind
I get a kick out of some of these “Big City Fishermen” w/ 20# tackle boxes, groceries like Gordon Ramsey is flying to cook for them and the how many clothes & gadgets they have to show off.

I have been on 20 fly in's and have not made weight yet. Sometimes we get charged and sometimes we don't. Even if we are charged, a couple hundred lbs over for 8 guys is a drop in the bucket compared to the overall cost of the trip.

I made 30 or so trips into the Boundary Waters Canoe Area in Northern MN. One incentive to make weight is when you have to carry every ounce you put in your pack over multiple portages some of which can be over 1/2 mile long.

Thanks all - definitely some things are learned by experience I think My tackle box is much smaller now than it was on my first trip for sure and we have also found using a water filter vs brining in bottled water saves a lot of weight Cheers Andrew
